newsitem.title: USA: DSG International sees earnings up in 96.
newsitem.headline: DSG International sees earnings up in 96.

text.p: DSG International Ltd said Monday it believes it is making strides and should post much better earnings in the 1996 fiscal year.

For the 1995 fiscal year, the company reported net income of $4.69 million, or $0.58 per share, on revenues of $245.88 million. That was a drop from the prior year, when the company reported net income of $16.65 million, or $2.00 per share, on revenues of $218.77 million.
DSG Chairman Brandon Wang said in a statement that the company is "encouraged by the continued improvement in our operating margin."

"With the price of raw material remaining at favorable levels, improved productivity and robust growth in our Asia Pacific markets, I believe we can look forward to a much better year in terms of earnings in 1996," he added.
DSG, which is based in Hong Kong, makes disposable diapers.
